snippet: Ebony Parchment moved to New York from Jamaica when she was 14 in hopes of forging a bond with her father. When he shattered those hopes, she had to overcome a series of obstacles.
abstract: Ebony Parchment of Harlem is given rent assistance by Community Service Society of New York in order to escape eviction; society is one of seven charities supported by The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund.
lead_paragraph: Ebony Parchment moved to New York from Jamaica when she was 14 in hopes of forging a bond with her father. When he shattered those hopes, she had to overcome a series of obstacles.

headline.print_headline: Refusing to Allow Abuse to Knock Her Off Course
headline.main: Refusing to Let Her Father’s Abuse Knock Her Off Course
